doc.name: startUpIconic

syntax.example: set the startupIconic of stack to {true | false}

doc.summary: Specifies whether, when a stack opens, it should be iconified or displayed as a window.

examples.example: set the startupIconic of stack "Imports" to true

description.p: Use the startUpIconic property to control a stack's appearance when it first opens.
The startUpIconic of a stack is true or false.
By default, the startUpIconic property of newly created stacks is set to false.
If a stack's startUpIconic property is set to true, the stack is opened as a desktop icon rather than a window.
The setting of this property has no effect on Mac OS or Windows systems, nor on some Unix systems.
